alert.note: Alert for Lonoke; Pulaski (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:02PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lonoke and southeastern Pulaski Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 502 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wrightsville, or 15 miles southeast of Southwest Little Rock, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Wrightsville... Keo... Sweet Home... Estes... Toltec Mounds State Park... Scott... Protho Junction... Baucum... Hensley... Higgins... Bredlow Corner... Willow Beach... Toltec... Rose City... College Station... Woodson... Terry Lock and Dam... This includes the following highways... Interstate 530 between mile markers 13 and 16. Interstate 440 between mile markers 3 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
